titleStmt.title: Poor Robin's dream; commonly called, Poor charity I know no reason, but this harmless riddle, may as well be printed, as sung to a fiddle. To a compleat tune, well known by musicians, and many others: or, game at cards.

Poor Robin's dream; commonly called, Poor charity I know no reason, but this harmless riddle, may as well be printed, as sung to a fiddle. To a compleat tune, well known by musicians, and many others: or, game at cards.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for A[lexander] M[ilbourn] and W[illiam] O[nley],

notesStmt.note: Verse - "How now good fellow, what all amort?".
Printer's names from Wing; these printers active in London, 1684-1697 (cf. Plomer); Wing conjectures date: [1689-94?].
Printed in black-letter in four columns with woodcuts at head of each.
Copy cropped along right margin with some loss of print.
Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
